projectPurpose: To provide a robust, open-source library written in Rust for implementing the Microsoft Remote Desktop Protocol, enabling developers to build RDP client or server applications.
mainFeatures: Provides crates for building RDP clients and servers
Supports various RDP graphics codecs (Bitmap, RLE, RDP 6.0, RemoteFX)

alternatives.name: FreeRDP
mainFeatures: Cross-platform RDP client and server implementation

alternatives.name: xrdp
alternatives.license: Open Source - Apache License 2.0, GNU General Public License
mainFeatures: RDP server for non-Windows operating systems
Supports connections from standard RDP clients

alternatives.name: rdesktop
alternatives.license: Open Source - GNU General Public License
mainFeatures: Basic RDP client for Unix-like systems

marketPositioning: IronRDP is positioned as a modern, secure, and performant open-source RDP protocol implementation written in Rust. Unlike comprehensive end-user focused alternatives like FreeRDP and xrdp, IronRDP provides the core RDP library components for developers to build their own custom RDP clients and servers. Its Rust foundation appeals to developers prioritizing memory safety and performance. Its use in commercial products, including those enabling browser-based access via WebAssembly, highlights its strength as a library for integration into advanced remote access solutions.
